snippet: Donald J. Trump routed Marco Rubio in Florida on Tuesday, giving Mr. Trump a delegate advantage that will be very difficult for any rival to overcome before the Republican convention.
abstract: Marco Rubio drops out of Republican presidential race after defeat by Donald J Trump in Florida primary, but Gov John Kasich's win in Ohio increases Trump's difficulty in seizing nomination; Kasich's victory, along with strong showing by Sen Ted Cruz in Illinois, North Carolina and Missouri, offer Trump's opponents hope of denying him nomination, but alternatives are both imperfect and uncertain.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and ALEXANDER BURNS

lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump routed Marco Rubio in Florida on Tuesday, giving Mr. Trump a delegate advantage that will be very difficult for any rival to overcome before the Republican convention.

headline.main: Donald Trump Takes 3 States; John Kasich Wins Ohio
headline.print_headline: Trump Takes Florida and 2 Other States; Kasich Wins Ohio
